item.title: By: Denys
item.dc:creator: Denys
item.description: Transitioning to New Face Moisterizer - How? So, a couple weeks ago, I ran out of my OHA face moisturizer, which I've been using for a couple of years. I wasn't going to order anymore because I was going to transition to Origins Anti-aging Face Cream (which is really a moisturizer, but they just call it a cream). Anyway, I keep stalling on ordering my new moisturizer, so while at Target, I picked up some cetaphil (on your suggestion). I love the texture of it and that it has an SPF in it. However, since I've been using it, my face has been more oily than usual (before Cetaphil, I was using a 60 SPF Vanicream under my OHA moisturizer (Vanicream was recommended by my dermatologist). ANYWAY...is there a particular transition strategy that I should use when moving away from the old and towards the new (like you use when changing dog food)? Or do I just dive in? And is my sking just going through an adjustment period with the Cetaphil? I just don't know. I'm worried that when I finally get my new Origins moisturizer ordered, my skin will really freak out. Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
Transitioning to New Face Moisterizer – How?
So, a couple weeks ago, I ran out of my OHA face moisturizer, which I’ve been using for a couple of years. I wasn’t going to order anymore because I was going to transition to Origins Anti-aging Face Cream (which is really a moisturizer, but they just call it a cream). Anyway, I keep stalling on ordering my new moisturizer, so while at Target, I picked up some cetaphil (on your suggestion). I love the texture of it and that it has an SPF in it. However, since I’ve been using it, my face has been more oily than usual (before Cetaphil, I was using a 60 SPF Vanicream under my OHA moisturizer (Vanicream was recommended by my dermatologist). ANYWAY…is there a particular transition strategy that I should use when moving away from the old and towards the new (like you use when changing dog food)? Or do I just dive in? And is my sking just going through an adjustment period with the Cetaphil? I just don’t know. I’m worried that when I finally get my new Origins moisturizer ordered, my skin will really freak out. Thanks!
